'Monosodium glutamate', also known as 'sodium glutamate' or 'MSG', is the sodium
salt of glutamic acid, one of the most abundant naturally occurring non-
essential amino acids. It was classified by
the U.S. Food and Drug Administration as generally recognized as safe (GRAS) and
by the European Union as a food additive. MSG has the HS code 29224220 and the E
number E621. The glutamate of MSG confers the same umami taste of
glutamate from other foods, being chemically identical.
Industrial food manufacturers market and use MSG as a flavor enhancer because it
balances, blends and rounds the total perception of other tastes. Trade names of monosodium
glutamate include Ac'cent, Aji-No-Moto, and Vetsin.
